TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is an NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the Court by Ms A. GPE , a senior welfare rights officer in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant ’s wife died on DATE . On DATE , the applicant made a claim for widows’ benefits . On DATE the applicant was informed that his claim had been disallowed as he was not a woman . The applicant appealed and on DATE his appeal was rejected . The applicant did not appeal further as he considered or was advised that such a remedy would be bound to fail since no such social security benefit was payable to widowers under GPE law .
The domestic law relevant to this application is set out in Runkee and White v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL , DATE .
